properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the Sydney Shimmer Festival on Forbes and Bourke Streets in Darlinghurst. The event will run on Friday 5pm to 11pm, Saturday 10am to 11pm and Sunday 10am to 5pm.

The following roads will be closed from 4am Friday 14 October to 10am Monday 17 October:

  • Forbes St between Burton St and Bourke St
  • Bourke St between Forbes St and Burton St

Special event clearways will also be in effect on both sides of these roads from 4am Friday 14 October to 1am Monday 17 October. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully for the most up-to-date information as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.publicTransport: Bus services will divert around the closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the annual italian festival held along Norton Street from 10am to 5pm. 

Traffic will be heavy in the area and on approach to Leichhardt including Parramatta Rd, City West Link Rd and Great Western Hwy. Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and expect delays.

Roads will be closed from 3am to 9pm Norton St will be closed between Marion St and William St, and surrounding local roads including sections of Arthur St, Allen St, Short St and Wetherill St.

From 6am to 9pm sections of Allen Street, Carlisle St, Derbyshire Rd, Lou St, Macauley St, Marlborough Street will also be closed. Local access will be maintained through Macauley St and Wetherill St.

Special event clearways will be in effect along both sides of Norton St between Marion St and William St from 3am to 9pm. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

From 3am to 9pm:

  • Norton Street between Marion Street and William Street
  • Allen Street between Derbyshire Road and Norton Street
  • Arthur Street between Allen Street and Short Street
  • Short Street between Norton Street and Balmain Road
  • Wetherill Street* between Norton Street and Balmain Road

* Vehicle access will be maintained to Wetherill St for local residents entry and exit via Derbyshire Rd.

 

From 6am to 9pm:

  • Allen Street between Norton Street and James Street
  • Carlisle Street between Norton Street and Cromwell Street
  • Derbyshire Road at William Street
  • Macauley Street* between Norton Street and Cromwell Street
  • Marlborough Street between Norton Street and Cromwell Street
  • Lou Street, parallel to Norton Street between Marion Street and Allen Street
  • Un-named lane off Short Street
  • * Vehicle access will be maintained to Macauley St for local residents entry and exit via Cromwell St


SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call the Traffic Information Line on 132 701 to find its new location.

LEICHHARDT - FROM 3AM TO 9PM

  • Norton St between Marion St and William St (both sides)

properties.otherAdvice: Vincent Street will be closed from Wollombi Rd to Hall St; Cooper St will be closed from Cumberland St to Charlton St and Charlton St will be closed from the North Charlton car park to 50m south of Cooper St.
properties.diversions:
Light Vehicle Detours-

Eastbound traffic on Wollombi Road will be detoured via Cumberland Street and Hall Street.

Westbound traffic on Wollombi Road will be detoured via Darwin Street and Hall Street.

Northbound traffic on Vincent Street will be detoured via Cumberland Street or Darwin Street.

Heavy Vehicle Detours-

Northbound heavy vehicles will be directed to detour via Aberdare Rd, South St, Darwin St and Wollombi Rd.

Southbound heavy vehicles will be directed to detour via Wollombi Rd, Darwin St, South St and Aberdare Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Buses will run frequently between the city, Bondi Junction and Bondi Beach. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Sculpture by the Sea returns to the Bondi to Tamarama coastal walk from Friday 21 October to Monday 7 November. Local road closures will be in place each day of the event from 7:30am to 6:30pm.

Significant delays are expected on roads approaching the area during the event, particularly on weekends. Motorists should avoid the area where possible or allow plenty of extra travel time on Bondi Road, Old South Head Road and Syd Einfeld Drive approaching Bondi Beach. 

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect along both sides of Bondi Road each weekend of the event on Saturday 22 and Sunday 23 October, Saturday 29 and Sunday 30 October, and Saturday 5 and Sunday 6 November:

  • 7am to 2pm: Bondi Rd from Oxford St at Bondi Junction to Sandridge St at Bondi Beach.
  • 12pm midday to 8pm: Bondi Rd from Sandridge St at Bondi Beach to Oxford St at Bondi Junction.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event on Redfern St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Redfern St will be closed between Regent St and Chalmers St in both directions from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Renwick St, George St and Glover St will also be closed during this time.
  • Pitt St will remain open to allow traffic to pass through Redfern St.
  • Motorists travelling west will be detoured via Chalmers St, Cleveland St and Regent St. Motorists travelling east will be detoured via Regent St, Botany Rd and Raglan St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 10:30pm on sections of Redfern St, George St and Renwick St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee apply

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while closures are in place. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event in Haymarket. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Hay St will be closed in both directions between Sussex St and Harbour St from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Harbour St, Sussex St, Little Hay St, Factory St, Kimber Ln and Little Pier St will also be closed during this time.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Hay St, Harbour St, Sussex St and Little Hay St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee apply

Banna Avenue will be closed between Crossing Street and Jondaryan Avenue at the following times:

  • Set up - Sun 9 Oct 6am-2:30pm
  • Event launch - Fri 14 Oct 4:30pm-10:30pm
  • Pack up - Sun 22 Oct 6am-2:30pm

Detour for all vehicles via Bridge St/Crossing St during these times.

A speed zone reduction and heavy vehicle detour will be in place at all other times during the exhibition.
properties.diversions: Heavy vehicle detour via Bridge St and Crossing St during exhibition.

properties.otherAdvice: Speed will be reduced between Yerambla Close and St Johns Drive.

NBL: Illawarra Hawks v New Zealand Breakers. Tip-off from 7:30pm, full time around 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Sections of Harbour St at the Stadium will be closed for crowd safety. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Tame Impala Concert at Qudos Bank Arena. Starts from 7:45pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Event tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Spring Champions Stakes Day - The Everest Carnival at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 12:30pm, last race at 6:10pm. Concert finishes at 7:30pm

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as race goers travel to and from the racecourse. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in place at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Stanley Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Road closures will be in place between 9am and 11:30pm on sections of Stanley St, Riley St and Yurong St.

Motorists will be detoured via Crown Street, William Street, College Street and Francis Street.

﻿Special event clearways will also be in effect on sections of these streets from 8am until 11:30pm

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

﻿Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.otherAdvice:
Bruno Mars concerts at Allianz Stadium. Gates open 5.30pm each night, acts start nights from 7.30pm, finish around 10.30pm.

With a crowd of up to 40,000 expected each night, traffic will be heavy particularly during the already busy evening peak on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 Kippax car park from Moore Park Rd, or from the Eastern Distributor use the Bondi exit. Access EP3 southern grass car park or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit.

Special event clearways are in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until midnight including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Chalmers St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of cyclists have taken to the streets from St Leonards Park in North Sydney to Tumbalong Park in Darling Harbour for the 10km ride or to Cathy Freeman Park in Sydney Olympic Park for the 50km ride in the annual Spring Cycle event.

From Darling Harbour to Olympic Park riders are sharing roads with motorists and abiding by regular road rules. Drivers are reminded to leave a 1.5m distance when overtaking cyclists on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under. Road closures will be in place along the first 10km of the course.

**All roads in the Sydney CBD and North Sydney have reopened. Cyclists are now sharing roads with motorists on course to Olympic Park**

Local roads in Olympic Park are also be closed between 7.30am and 3pm. See the interactive map for more info.

arrangementElements.title: Road closures

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies. If your vehicle is towed it will be relocated to the nearest legal parking space, use the Find My Car website or call 132 701 to find its new location.

North Sydney

From 3:00am to 9:30am

  • Miller Street between Blue St and Pacific Highway Western side

From 3:00am to 10:30am

  • Berry Street between Pacific Highway and Arthur Street
  • Miller Street between Pacific Hwy and Berry Street Western side
  • Miller Street between Berry Street and Ridge Street

From 3:00am to 11:00am

  • Arthur Street between Pacific Highway and Mount Street Western side
  • Arthur Street between Berry Street and Mount Street
  • Carlow Street between Tucker Street and Miller Street
  • Miller Street between Ridge Street and Falcon Street

From 3:00am to 11:00am

  • Dalgety Road between Bettington Street and Towns Place Western side
  • Erskine Street between Shelley Street and York Street Northern side
  • Sussex Street between Erskine Street and King Street

From 3:00am to 11:00am

*Authorised Route Buses Excepted

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
More than 3,500 cyclists will take part in The Bowral Classic over two days this year Saturday 15 and Sunday 16 October. On Saturday riders will take part in The Crit races around Loseby Park, Bowral.

On Sunday riders will take part in a 150km, 120km, 85km or 35km ride, starting from 6.30am on Bong Bong St in Bowral travelling south to Bundanoon or Robertson before returning to finish at Loseby Park in Bowral. Changed traffic arrangements and road closures will be in place 

Bong Bong St, Bowral will be closed between Banyette St and Merrigang St from 4am to 9am on Sunday. 

Other local roads in Bowral, Moss Vale and the Southern Highlands area will also close for the event. Local diversions will be in place:

Saturday

  • Bowral: From 8:30am until 8:30pm sections of Loseby St, Ascot St, Sheffield St and Park Rd will be closed.

Sunday

  • Bowral: Between 4am and 4pm sections of Oxley Dr, Duke St, Park Rd, Station St, Wingecarribee St and Oxleys Hill Rd will be closed. 
  • Bundanoon: From 7:30am until 10:30am Ellsmore Rd northbound will be closed between Blue Gum Rd and Sallys Corner Road. 
  • Fitzroy Falls: Between 8:30am and 1pm sections of Nowra Rd, Myra Vale Rd and Pearsons Lane will be closed. 
  • Kangaloon: From 9am until 2:15pm Tourist Rd/Kirkland Rd will be closed to southbound/eastbound traffic between Range Rd and Kangaloon Rd.
  • Glenquarry/Mittagong: From 9:30am until 2:30pm Range Rd will be closed to southbound/eastbound traffic between Old South Rd and Tourist Rd.

A speed limit reduction will be in effect along both directions of the Illawarra Hwy between Lackey Rd and Old Argyle Rd as well as Moss Vale Road between Church St and Eridge Park Rd.

Stop/slow traffic control will be in place on sections of the Illawarra Hwy at Moss Vale, Nowra Rd at Fitzroy Falls and the Illawarra Hwy at Robertson. Motorists should allow extra time and expect some delays.

Motorists are also reminded when overtaking cyclists to leave a 1.5m distance on roads with speed limits over 60km/h and a 1m distance on roads 60km/h or under.

roads.mainStreet: Various roads incl Bong Bong Rd, Illawarra Hwy and Nowra Rd in the Southern Highlands

properties.otherAdvice: Speed reductions will be in place for north and southbound motorists. Alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place on the Barton Highway at Field Days entrance.
properties.diversions: Event traffic detour via Euroka Ave, Patemans Lane and Murrumbateman Road will be in place.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Macarthur FC v Adelaide United at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Start from 3pm, finish approx 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
More than 3,000 people are expected to attend the 2022 NSW Touch Football Country Championships at the Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex in Tuggerah from 8am to 6pm on Saturday and Sunday. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual along Bryant Dr and Lake Rd as attendees travel to and from the venue throughout the weekend.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.crossStreet: Central Coast Regional Sporting & Recreation Complex

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting around the road closures. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to visit the annual Crows Nest Fest on Willoughby Rd from 10am to 5pm.

Willoughby Rd will be closed between Falcon St and Albany St from 12am midnight until 10:30pm Sunday.

Other local roads joining Willoughby Rd will also be closed including sections of Burlington St, Clarke St, Holtermann St and Willoughby Ln.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as delays are expected on roads in the area including Ernest St, Falcon St, Chandos St and the Pacific Hwy
